intro: Seriphidium turcomanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan wormwood, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in regions such as Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, and Turkmenistan. Seriphidium turcomanicum is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
